config.title: Basic Configuration
config.description: Manage system basic parameters that affect site display and statistics behavior.
config.siteSettingsDesc: Configure site title, currency display unit, and dashboard statistics display policy.
config.autoCleanupDesc: Automatically clean up historical log data on schedule to free up database storage space.

form.allowGlobalViewDesc: Allow non-admin users to view global usage statistics
form.keepDaysDesc: Clean up logs older than this number of days
form.cleanupScheduleDesc: Select the execution schedule for automatic cleanup
form.configUpdated: System settings updated. The page will refresh to apply currency display changes.

providers.title: Provider Management
providers.description: Configure API service providers and maintain availability status.
providers.subtitle: Provider Management
providers.subtitleDesc: Configure upstream provider rate limiting and concurrent session limits. Leave empty for unlimited.
providers.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this provider?

form.name: Name
form.baseUrlRequired: Please fill in provider URL first
form.apiKeyOptional: Leave empty to keep existing key
form.weightDesc: Weighted random probability. Within same priority, higher weight = higher selection probability. E.g. weights 1:2:3 = probabilities 16%:33%:50%
form.priorityDesc: Lower number = higher priority (0 is highest). System only selects from highest priority providers. Recommendation: Main=0, Backup=1, Emergency=2
form.costMultiplierDesc: Cost calculation multiplier. Official=1.0, 20% cheaper=0.8, 20% more expensive=1.2 (up to 4 decimal places)
form.limitConcurrentDesc: e.g. Provider C has limit of 2, currently 2 active sessions
form.limitAmount5hDesc: e.g. Provider B has $10 limit, $9.8 consumed
form.modelRedirectsDesc: Redirect Claude Code client model requests (e.g. claude-sonnet-4.5) to upstream provider supported models (e.g. glm-4.6, gemini-pro). For cost optimization or third-party AI integration.
form.sourceModelRequired: Source model name cannot be empty
form.targetModelRequired: Target model name cannot be empty
form.proxyFallbackDesc: When enabled, auto try direct connection on proxy failure
form.apiKeyLeaveEmptyDesc: Leave empty to keep existing key
form.websiteUrlDesc: Provider website URL for quick access
form.websiteUrlInvalid: Please enter a valid provider website URL
form.providerTypeDesc: Select the API format type for the provider.
form.providerTypeDisabledNote: Note: Gemini CLI and OpenAI Compatible types are under development
form.modelRedirectsEmpty: No redirect rules yet. System will auto-rewrite model names after adding rules.
form.modelRedirectsSourceRequired: Source model name cannot be empty
form.modelRedirectsTargetRequired: Target model name cannot be empty
form.modelRedirectsExists: Model "{model}" already has a redirect rule
form.joinClaudePoolDesc: When enabled, this provider will participate in load balancing with Claude type providers
form.joinClaudePoolHelp: Only available when model redirect config contains mappings to claude-* models. When enabled, this provider will also participate in scheduling when users request claude-* models.
form.modelWhitelistDesc: Limit models this provider can handle. By default, provider can handle all models of its type.
form.modelWhitelistManualDesc: Support adding any model name (not limited to price table)
form.modelWhitelistSelectedOnly: Only allow selected {count} models. Requests for other models won't be routed to this provider.
form.providerGroupDesc: Provider group tag. Only users with matching providerGroup can use this provider. Example: Set to "premium" to allow only providerGroup="premium" users
form.circuitBreakerConfigSummary: {failureThreshold} failures / {openDuration} min circuit break / {successThreshold} successes to recover
form.circuitBreakerDesc: Auto circuit break on consecutive failures to avoid overall service quality impact
form.failureThresholdDesc: How many consecutive failures trigger circuit break
form.openDurationDesc: How long before auto entering half-open state
form.successThresholdDesc: How many successes in half-open state to fully recover
form.proxyConfigDesc: Configure proxy server to improve provider connectivity (supports HTTP, HTTPS, SOCKS4, SOCKS5)
form.proxyFallbackLabel: Fallback to direct on proxy failure
form.proxyTestDesc: Test provider URL access via configured proxy (uses HEAD request, no quota consumption)
form.proxyTestFillUrl: Please fill in provider URL first
form.proxyTestTimeout:
Connection timeout (5s). Please check:
1. Is proxy server accessible
2. Are proxy address and port correct
3. Are proxy credentials correct
form.codexStrategyDesc: Control how to handle Codex request instructions field, affects upstream gateway compatibility
form.codexStrategyAutoDesc: Pass through client instructions, auto retry with official prompt on 400 error
form.codexStrategyForceDesc: Always use official Codex CLI instructions (~4000+ chars)
form.codexStrategyKeepDesc: Always pass through client instructions, no auto retry (for lenient gateways)
form.codexStrategyHint: Hint: Some strict Codex gateways (e.g. 88code, foxcode) require official instructions. Choose "Auto" or "Force Official" strategy
form.validUrlRequired: Please enter a valid API address

providers.schedulingDesc: Understand how provider selection works with priority layering, session reuse, load balancing and failover

guide.priorityStep: System first filters by priority, selecting only from highest priority providers
guide.priorityResult: Filtered to highest priority (0) providers: A, C
guide.weight: Weighted random selection based on weight
guide.weightCalc: C has 75% selection probability, A has 25%
guide.costSortExample: All providers: A (default), B (premium), C (premium), D (economy)
guide.costSortProb: Lower cost C has higher selection probability
guide.sessionDesc: If the last used provider is unavailable, reselect
guide.sessionLastUsed: B is available, reuse directly, skip random selection
guide.sessionExpired: Session automatically released after expiration (5 minutes)
guide.sessionUnavailable: Last used provider B is disabled or circuit-broken
guide.groupDesc: If user has provider group specified, system prioritizes selection from that group
guide.groupFiltered: Select only from A and C, B and D filtered
guide.groupFallback: If no available providers in user group, fallback to all providers
guide.groupUnavailable: All providers in user group 'vip' are disabled or over limit
guide.groupDowngrade: Log warning and select from global provider pool
guide.healthCheck: Check if B is enabled and healthy
guide.healthCheckCircuit: Provider A failed 5 times, circuit breaker: open
guide.healthCheckConcurrent: Check if current active session count exceeds limit
guide.healthCheckConcurrentExample: Provider C limit 2, currently 2 active sessions
guide.healthFiltered: B filtered (near limit), remaining: C, D
guide.historyDesc: Query providers used by this API Key in last 10 seconds
guide.circuitBreakerOpen: A filtered, remaining: B, C, D
guide.circuitBreakerRecovery: A automatically recovers to half-open after 60 seconds
guide.title: Core Principles
guide.priorityFirst: 1️⃣ Priority First: Select only from highest priority (lowest number) providers
guide.costOptimize: 2️⃣ Cost Optimization: Within same priority, lower cost multiplier has higher probability
guide.healthFilter: 3️⃣ Health Filtering: Auto skip circuit-broken or over-limit providers
guide.sessionReuse: 4️⃣ Session Reuse: Consecutive chats reuse same provider, saving context costs
guide.bestPracticesWeight: • Weight Config: Set weight by capacity (higher capacity = higher weight)
guide.bestPracticesCost: • Cost Multiplier: Official=1.0, Self-hosted can be 0.8-1.2
guide.bestPracticesLimit: • Limit Settings: Set 5h, 7d, 30d limits based on budget
guide.bestPracticesConcurrent: • Concurrent Control: Set session concurrency by provider API limits
guide.scenario1Desc: System first filters by priority, selecting only from highest priority providers
guide.scenario1Step1After: Filtered to highest priority (0) providers: A, C
guide.scenario1Step1Decision: Select only from A and C, B and D filtered out
guide.scenario1Step2Desc: Within same priority, sort by cost multiplier low to high
guide.scenario1Step2Decision: Lower cost C has higher selection probability
guide.scenario1Step3Desc: Use weight for random selection, higher weight = higher probability
guide.scenario2Desc: If user has provider group specified, system prioritizes selection from that group
guide.scenario2Step1Before: All providers: A (default), B (premium), C (premium), D (economy)
guide.scenario2Step1Decision: Select only from B and C
guide.scenario2Step2Desc: If no available providers in user group, fallback to all providers
guide.scenario2Step2Before: All providers in user group 'vip' disabled or over limit
guide.scenario2Step2After: Fallback to all enabled providers: A, B, C, D
guide.scenario2Step2Decision: Log warning and select from global provider pool
guide.scenario3Desc: System auto filters circuit-broken or over-limit providers
guide.scenario3Step1Desc: Circuit breaker opens after 5 consecutive failures, unavailable for 60s
guide.scenario3Step1Before: Provider A failed 5 times, circuit breaker: open
guide.scenario3Step1After: A filtered, remaining: B, C, D
guide.scenario3Step1Decision: A auto recovers to half-open after 60s
guide.scenario3Step2After: B filtered (near limit), remaining: C, D
guide.scenario3Step3Desc: Check if active session count exceeds configured concurrent limit
guide.scenario3Step3Before: Provider C concurrent limit 2, currently 2 active sessions
guide.scenario3Step3Decision: Auto release after session expiry (5 min)
guide.scenario4Desc: Consecutive chats prioritize using same provider, leveraging Claude context cache
guide.scenario4Step1Desc: Query providers used by this API Key in last 10 seconds
guide.scenario4Step1After: Check if B is enabled and healthy
guide.scenario4Step1Decision: B available, reuse directly, skip random selection
guide.scenario4Step2Desc: If last used provider unavailable, reselect
guide.scenario4Step2Before: Last used provider B disabled or circuit-broken

section.title: Provider Management
section.description: Configure upstream provider rate limiting and concurrent session limits. Leave empty for unlimited.

providers.confirmDeleteDesc: Are you sure you want to delete provider "{name}"? This action cannot be undone.
providers.confirmDeleteProviderDesc: Are you sure you want to delete provider "{name}"? This action is irreversible.
providers.viewKeyDesc: Please keep it safe and don't share it with others

prices.title: Pricing
prices.description: Manage platform basic configuration and model pricing
prices.subtitle: Model Pricing

sync.successNoChanges: All {unchanged} model prices are up to date
sync.failedNoResult: Sync successful but no result returned

prices.syncNoResult: Price table updated but no result returned

upload.dialogDescription: Select a JSON file containing model price data to update the price table
upload.selectFile: Click to select JSON file or drag and drop here
upload.noResult: Price table updated successfully but no result returned

prices.noData: System has built-in price table. Use buttons above to sync or update.

table.noDataHint: Built-in price table available. Use buttons above to sync or update

dialog.title: Update Model Price Table
dialog.description: Upload JSON file to update model pricing configuration
dialog.selectFile: Click to select JSON file or drag and drop here

notes.litellm: • Built-in LiteLLM price table. Use 'Sync LiteLLM Prices' button on the left to update
notes.support: • Supports Claude and OpenAI models (claude-, gpt-, o1-, o3- prefix)

sensitiveWords.title: Sensitive Words Management
sensitiveWords.description: Configure sensitive word filtering rules to block requests with sensitive content.

list.title: Sensitive Words List
list.description: Requests blocked by sensitive words will not be forwarded upstream or charged. Supports contains matching, exact matching, and regex patterns.

form.wordPlaceholder: Enter sensitive word or regex pattern

section.title: Sensitive Words List
section.description: Requests blocked by sensitive words will not be forwarded upstream and will not be charged. Supports contains matching, exact matching, and regex patterns.

sensitiveWords.refreshCacheSuccess: Cache refreshed successfully, loaded {count} sensitive words
sensitiveWords.emptyState: No sensitive words yet. Click 'Add Sensitive Word' in the top right to start configuration.
sensitiveWords.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete the sensitive word "{word}"?

dialog.addDescription: Configure sensitive word filtering rules. Matched requests will not be forwarded upstream.
dialog.editDescription: Modify sensitive word configuration. Changes will automatically refresh the cache.
dialog.matchTypeContains: Contains Match - Block if text contains this word
dialog.matchTypeExact: Exact Match - Block only if exact match
dialog.matchTypeRegex: Regular Expression - Support complex pattern matching

logs.title: Log Management
logs.description: Dynamically adjust system log level to control logging verbosity in real-time.
logs.subtitle: Log Level Control
logs.subtitleDesc: Changes take effect immediately without restart. Useful for troubleshooting in production.

data.title: Data Management
data.description: Manage database backup and recovery with full data import/export and log cleanup.

status.title: Database Status
status.description: View current database connection status and basic information.

cleanup.title: Log Cleanup
cleanup.description: Clean up historical log data to free up database storage. Statistics data will be retained.
cleanup.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to clean up historical logs? This action is irreversible.

export.title: Data Export
export.description: Export database as backup file for data migration or disaster recovery.

import.title: Data Import
import.description: Restore database from backup file with support for overwrite and merge modes.
import.selectFile: Click to select JSON file or drag and drop here

guide.title: Usage Instructions and Precautions
guide.cleanup: Log Cleanup: Physically delete historical log data (irreversible). Statistics table will be retained. Recommend exporting database backup before cleanup.
guide.format: Backup Format: Uses PostgreSQL custom format (.dump), auto-compressed and compatible with different database versions.
guide.overwrite: Overwrite Mode: Deletes all existing data before importing, ensuring database matches backup exactly. Best for complete recovery.
guide.merge: Merge Mode: Retains existing data and attempts to insert backup data. Primary key conflicts may cause import failure.
guide.backup: Security Recommendation: Before importing, recommend exporting current database as backup to avoid data loss.
guide.docker: Environment Requirements: This feature requires Docker Compose deployment. Local development may not support it.

clientVersions.title: Client Update Reminder
clientVersions.description: Manage client version requirements to ensure users use latest stable version. VSCode plugin and CLI are managed separately.

settings.title: Update Reminder Settings
settings.description: When enabled, system automatically detects client version and blocks old version users.

distribution.title: Client Version Distribution
distribution.description: Shows client version info for active users in past 7 days. Each client type independently tracks GA versions.

empty.title: No client data available
empty.description: No active users using recognizable clients in past 7 days

toggle.description: When enabled, system will block requests from old version clients

features.title: Feature Description
features.autoDetect: System automatically detects the latest stable version (GA version) for each client type
features.gaRuleDesc: A version is considered GA when used by more than 1 user
features.activeWindowDesc: Only counts users with requests in the past 7 days
features.blockOldVersion: Users with old versions will receive HTTP 400 error and cannot continue using the service
features.errorMessage: Error message includes current version and required upgrade version
features.recommendationDesc: Monitor the version distribution below and confirm new version stability before enabling.

notifications.title: Push Notifications
notifications.description: Configure WeChat Work robot push notifications

global.title: Notification Master Switch
global.description: Enable or disable all push notification features

circuitBreaker.title: Circuit Breaker Alert
circuitBreaker.description: Immediately push alert when provider is completely circuit-broken

dailyLeaderboard.title: Daily User Spending Leaderboard
dailyLeaderboard.description: Send top N user spending leaderboard daily on schedule
dailyLeaderboard.timeError: Time format error, should be HH:mm

costAlert.title: Cost Alert
costAlert.description: Trigger alert when user/provider spending exceeds quota threshold
costAlert.thresholdHelp: Trigger alert when spending reaches {percent}% of quota

form.success: Notification settings saved and tasks rescheduled
form.webhookRequired: Please fill in Webhook URL first
form.testSuccess: Test message sent. Check WeChat Work.
form.testNoResult: Test succeeded but no result returned
